title: Regression in rustdoc of re-export involving namespace overlap

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-cross-crate-reexports
labels.description: Area: Documentation that has been re-exported from a different crate

body:
```rust
// src/lib.rs

mod thing {
    pub use core::sync::atomic::AtomicU8; // anything from a dependency, type namespace

    #[allow(non_upper_case_globals)]
    pub const AtomicU8: () = (); // value namespace
}

pub use crate::thing::AtomicU8;
```

| `cargo +nightly-2022-12-02 doc` | `cargo +nightly-2022-12-03 doc` |
|---|---|
| ![Screenshot from 2022-12-14 22-02-13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1940490/207784613-3097419b-22ff-4e7b-8f68-52422c73b8fe.png) | ![Screenshot from 2022-12-14 22-02-08](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1940490/207784638-7079382a-361b-4bb7-a542-aa396a52e877.png) |

I believe the one on the left is what I would consider the correct rendering, and the one on the right is a regression.

The regression is in nightly-2022-12-03, specifically https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/104963 according to bisect, which makes sense. Mentioning @petrochenkov @cjgillot in case an obvious cause stands out to either of you.
